headline: Famed Courbet self-portrait exhibited in France for first time in 17 years

headline: Berthe Weill at the Musée de l'Orangerie in Paris, the treasures of an eclectic gallerist
subhead: The institution shines a light on the art dealer (1865-1951) who exhibited works by Matisse and Picasso from 1900 onward, as well as on many artists from the different movements of her era.

headline: Eight key moments in the frantic week that led to France's new government

headline: Paris's remarkable fashion week masks the luxury industry's headlong rush
subhead: By reigniting the dream machine, the so-called 'fashion week of the century' has signaled the rise of a new generation of designers – but without revealing anything about the intentions of the leaders of luxury conglomerates.

headline: Trump's 20-point plan for Gaza, explained and analyzed
